intro: Sphaeralcea chenopodifolia, commonly known as desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its glandular, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Sphaeralcea chenopodifolia is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
